did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South records 1939-2009

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Duke University. David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the library's online catalog.
did.abstract: A non-profit organization, located in Greensboro, N.C., founded in 1977 for the purpose of providing support for women in ministry, persons of faith working for justice in the South, and religious organizations that address women's needs.

The records are relevant to the study of the relationships among religion, politics, and society, particularly how women in ministry have confronted a number of social issues facing the South. Information pertaining to the Equal Rights Amendment, sexism, economic justice and poverty, gays and lesbians in the Church, feminism, abortion, racism, and rural ministry is included. Also includes materials on retreats and conferences, some organized by the Resource Center, which focused on many of the issues above and other concerns, including gender and language, spirituality, medical care, housing and homelessness, women in ministry, and women in the workplace.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in the Resource Center For Women and Ministry in the South Records have not been transferred to Duke University. For further information, see the section on copyright in the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South Records were donated to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1991 and 1992. Additional materials have been donated in subsequent years, including 1994, 1995, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2011.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Janie Morris and Daniel Daily
Updated by Meghan Lyon, 2009; Meghan Lyon and Carrie Mills, 2011.

chronitem.event: Incorporated as a nonprofit organization. Jeanette Stokes was listed as the incorporator and a trustee. Helen G. Crotwell and Sue Parkerson were also named as trustees
Tax exempt status approved by the Internal Revenue Service
Began publishing South of the Garden, newsletter for the organization. Issued for one year at no charge
Began selling subscriptions to South of the Garden
Women in Ministry in North Carolina conferences begun
Women, Faith and Economic Justice conferences begun
Keeping Yourself Together While Changing the World conferences begun
Women in Ministry in the Virginias conferences begun
Published brochure, Investment That Counts: A Guide to Socially Responsible Investing for People of Faith

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The records of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South span the years 1939 to 2008 with the bulk occurring from 1977 to 1990. The Resource Center's mission of working for justice in the South as well as its operations are reflected in the records, which primarily consist of printed material, correspondence, writings, clippings, account books, grant proposals, minutes, newsletters, photographs, audio tapes, filmstrips, and videocassette tapes.

The Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South Records are especially relevant to the study of the relationships among religion, politics and society. In particular they document how women, especially women in ministry, have confronted a number of social issues facing the South as well as the entire United States. Information pertaining to the Equal Rights Amendment, sexism, feminism, economic justice and poverty, gays and lesbians in the Church, Central America, child abuse, abortion and the abortion controversy, racism, and rural ministry is included in the records. Information on these issues as well as others is contained in the Alphabetical Files and Printed Material series. Retreats and conferences, some organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South, which focus on many of the above issues as well as other concerns, including gender and language, spirituality, housing and homelessness, women in ministry, health and medical care, and women in the workplace are reflected in the Alphabetical Files, Audiovisual, and Pictures series. Many of these retreats and conferences were held in North Carolina and Virginia. In the Printed Material Series, are copies of South of the Garden, a newsletter published by the Resource Center, resource packets pertaining to sexism and ministries to women in crisis among other subjects, and a number of religious newsletters that focus on women in the Church.

The records reflect the ecumenical vision of the Resource Center in that the major Protestant denominations are represented in the records. Within these denominations, women's organizations are the primary focus, including the Presbyterian Committee on Women's Concerns, the National Association of Presbyterian Clergy Women, and the United Church of Christ Clergywomen's Conference. Other religious bodies and organizations reflected in the records include the North Carolina Council of Churches - Committee for ERA, Religious Coalition for Abortion Rights, and programs for women at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro. Material pertaining to these organizations are primarily located in the Alphabetical Files; Financial Papers; Meetings, Conferences, and Workshops; and Printed Material series.

Significant individuals reflected in the records, primarily within the Audiovisual Series, include Rosemary Radford Ruether, Anne Wilson Schaef, Katie Cannon, and Carter Heyward. The correspondence, writings, sermons and addresses, and notes of Jeanette Stokes, Director of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South, are chiefly contained in the Financial Papers; Meetings, Conferences, and Workshops; and Audiovisual series. Documents concerning the operations and history of the Resource Center, including account books, grant proposals, and incorporation materials are primarily located in the Financial Papers and Miscellaneous Series.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

item.corpname: Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South
Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South. South of the Garden
University of North Carolina at Greensboro

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of printed material, correspondence, clippings, photographs, and writings. This series reflects some of the primary activities of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South. Included are programs and lecture notes from the various conferences that were organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South; and minutes of meetings for the North Carolina Council of Churches--Committee for ERA, and the National Abortion Rights Action League - North Carolina. Other organizations represented in this series include the Religious Coalition for Abortion Rights, the Guilford Women's Network, and the National Association of Presbyterian Clergywomen. Also includes resource materials on various social concerns, including racism, child abuse, and economic justice. Arranged alphabetically by topic and chronologically within folders.

scopecontent.p: Includes account books and receipts documenting the financial operation of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South. Also includes requests for outside funding and grant applications to various denominational organizations and other institutions. Financial information pertaining to the Resource Center is arranged chronologically at the beginning of the series, then alphabetically. Requests for funding are arranged in alphabetical order by fund name.

scopecontent.p: Contains printed material; writings; minutes from meetings; lecture and seminar notes; and correspondence related to meetings, conferences, or workshops in which Jeanette Stokes participated. The materials are not directly related to the seminars and conferences organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South; these are documented in the Alphabetical Files Series. Arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: Includes brochures for conferences organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South, religious newsletters, issues of South of the Garden, and surveys directed at readers of South of the Garden. Also contains resource packets concerning issues related to women in ministry, study guides, and correspondence pertaining to South of the Garden. The first part of the series is arranged chronologically. The remainder is chiefly arranged alphabetically by title. Issues of South of the Garden follow the newsletters.

scopecontent.p: Contains videocassette tapes, audio tapes, filmstrips, and printed material relating to the audiovisual media. Included are sermons and addresses, including those given at conferences organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South. Arranged chronologically. Numbers below correspond to those on the audiovisual material folders.

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of 3"x5" color photographs of participants at various conferences organized by the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South. Also included are black and white photographs and negatives. The first part of the series is arranged chronologically, the rest alphabetically by conference name.

scopecontent.p: Includes subscriptions to South of the Garden, correspondence concerning the formation and incorporation of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South, and timelines and other documents pertaining to the history of the Resource Center. Arranged alphabetically.
Partially processed addition (1994-083) (850 items; dated 1980-1992) comprises files pertaining to the Guilford Women's Network and miscellaneous conference, financial, and meeting files.

Partially processed additions (1995-035, 1995-082, 1997-114) (4000 items, dated 1980-[199-]) contain administrative files including those for Center-related projects such as the Women's Economic Justice Conference, the Women and Violence Conference, and the Body and Soul retreat, all in 1993, as well as the N.C. Workplace Reform Mission in 1994. There are other conference, workshop, financial, and meeting files, and various publications of the Center.

Addition (2003-240) (300 items, 0.8 lin. ft.; dated 1987-2003) contains files of RCWMS founder Jeanette Stokes; subject files; correspondence; writings and speeches; and publication files. Includes flyers, brochures, invitations, newsletters, and artifacts (political buttons and a banner).

Addition (2004-151) (1650 items, 2.6 lin. ft.; dated 1991-1999) consists primarily of files associated with events organized by the RCWMS; newsletter files; subject files; and research files. Includes drafts, correspondence, writings, reports, planning documents, schedules, printed material, and other administrative material.

Addition (2005-018) (750 items, 1.2 lin. ft.; dated 1998-2003) consists of financial records; meeting minutes, files, interviews, and notes of the North Carolina Council of Churches Task Group on the Effects of the Women's Movement on North Carolina Congregations. Also includes files on equal rights, violence against women, The Spirit Project, and the Reader's Theatre.

Addition (2006-115) (1500 items, 2.0 lin. ft.) includes newsletters, fundraising materials, financial records, reference materials for classes taught by Jeannette Stokes and catalogs. There is also correspondence, business records, schedules, agendas and promotional materials about conferences, workshops and other events. In addition there are 1982 clippings and ephemera about the Equal Rights Amendment and 4 audiocassettes recordings of interviews and sermons.
Addition (2007-0019) (762 items, 1.5 lin. ft.; dated 1990-2003) contains financial files; materials for classes, events, and workshops; one T-shirt and eleven audio cassettes.
